block.para: Concatenating translations of space corresponds to adding the representing vectors.

Shift an object into a different location using a translation vector \Vect{a}. Compare this with shifting the object twice as far in the same direction. The corresponding translation vector is 2\Vect{a}.
In general, shifting the object in the given direction times as far as the original translation does has the translation vector t\cdot \Vect{a}.
